title: Clutch Pack - Height

body.body: The clutch pack height is critical for a smooth operation of the transmission and must be measured prior to installation of new clutch plates.
When building a new clutch pack, its height must be correct. To achieve this, build the new clutch pack using the following:
1 x outer steel plate, 2.0 mm thick.
Arrange the new friction and new steel plates in a stack as shown below.
Place the assembled clutch pack on a flat surface and measure its height as shown below.
The clutch pack height for this clutch assembly is shown in the specification table see
If the clutch pack is too high, continue from step 5, omit step 6 then continue from step 7. If the clutch pack is too low, continue from step 6.
1.6 mm and 2.3 mm steel plates are available, refer to the Parts Catalogue for part numbers.
No more than one 1.6 mm thick steel plate is to be used in the clutch pack.
If the clutch pack height is too high, replace the 2.0 mm steel plate indicated below with a new 1.6 mm steel plate.

body.name: clutch pack height too low/too high D series

body.body: 2.0 mm steel plate to be replaced
No more than one 2.3 mm thick steel plate is to be used in the clutch pack.
If the clutch pack height is too low, replace the 2.0 mm steel plate indicated below with a new 2.3 mm steel plate.

body.name: clutch pack height too low/too high D series

body.body: 2.0 mm steel plate to be replaced
Re-check the clutch pack height as described previously.

metadata.products: D92; DB2; DP3; DC3; DP2; DC; DPA; DZ; DBX; DB; DP

search: Clutch Pack - Height
The clutch pack height is critical for a smooth operation of the transmission and must be measured prior to installation of new clutch plates.
When building a new clutch pack, its height must be correct. To achieve this, build the new clutch pack using the following:
2 x new outer friction plates
5 x new friction plates
1 x new inner friction plate
6 x steel plates, 2.0 mm thick
1 x outer steel plate, 2.0 mm thick.
Arrange the new friction and new steel plates in a stack as shown below.
Outer friction plates
Friction plates
Inner friction plate
Steel plate, 2.0 mm thickness
Outer steel plate, 2.0 mm thickness
Place the assembled clutch pack on a flat surface and measure its height as shown below.
Clutch pack height
The clutch pack height for this clutch assembly is shown in the specification table see
Clutch and Primary Drive
If the clutch pack is too high, continue from step 5, omit step 6 then continue from step 7. If the clutch pack is too low, continue from step 6.
1.6 mm and 2.3 mm steel plates are available, refer to the Parts Catalogue for part numbers.
No more than one 1.6 mm thick steel plate is to be used in the clutch pack.
If the clutch pack height is too high, replace the 2.0 mm steel plate indicated below with a new 1.6 mm steel plate.
2.0 mm steel plate to be replaced
No more than one 2.3 mm thick steel plate is to be used in the clutch pack.
If the clutch pack height is too low, replace the 2.0 mm steel plate indicated below with a new 2.3 mm steel plate.
2.0 mm steel plate to be replaced
Re-check the clutch pack height as described previously.
